Retina photoreceptor rod cell.Comment: Need clarification about the receptors.  What does "from horizontal cells" mean?
Retina photoreceptor rod cell.Definition: One of the two photoreceptor cell types of the vertebrate retina. Primarily used in night vision.  Rods significantly outnumber cones.  The photopigment is in stacks of membranous disks separate from the outer cell membrane. Rods are more sensitive to light than cones, but rod mediated vision has less spatial and temporal resolution than cone vision.
